intro: Arenaria paulsenii, commonly known as the Paulsen's sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of South America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss in harsh conditions. Arenaria paulsenii plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is of interest to botanists studying alpine flora.
